projects.title: Outram Residence
projects.introLifestyle: A quiet renovation of a 1980s apartment, reorganized around morning routines and evening privacy. The design opens the living area to morning light while creating clear separation between shared and private spaces.
projects.livingFramework: The spatial organization prioritizes circulation and storage. A new kitchen island anchors the open plan, while integrated joinery replaces freestanding furniture. Each intervention is measured against how the space is actually used.
projects.deliveryNote: Structured coordination ensured design intent carried through to completion. Regular site visits and direct communication with contractors maintained clarity throughout the build.

projects.title: River Valley Apartment
projects.introLifestyle: A three-bedroom apartment redesigned to support a family's daily patterns. The new layout creates distinct zones for work, rest, and gathering while maintaining visual connection throughout.
projects.livingFramework: Spatial proportion and flow were tested before material selection. The design removes unnecessary walls while preserving privacy where needed. A long storage wall provides both function and visual rhythm.
projects.deliveryNote: Active site oversight and structured decision-making kept the project on track. Weekly coordination meetings ensured alignment between design intent and execution.

projects.title: Tiong Bahru Apartment
projects.introLifestyle: A compact two-bedroom apartment optimized for a couple working from home. The design creates flexible spaces that adapt to different activities throughout the day.
projects.livingFramework: The spatial structure balances open areas with defined zones. A custom desk unit integrates into the living space, while the bedroom remains a quiet retreat. Storage is built-in rather than added.
projects.deliveryNote: Clear project governance and regular site visits maintained design quality. Direct coordination with trades ensured details were executed as specified.

projects.title: Bukit Timah House
projects.introLifestyle: A landed home renovation focused on improving natural light and circulation. The design opens interior spaces while maintaining privacy from the street.
projects.livingFramework: Spatial organization prioritizes flow between indoor and outdoor areas. The layout creates clear zones for different activities while preserving the home's original character.
projects.deliveryNote: Structured oversight and clear communication ensured the renovation proceeded smoothly. Regular site coordination maintained alignment with design intent.
